question_stem.en: A 45-year-old woman comes to the office due to 3 days of progressive pain in the right upper quadrant, nausea, and vomiting. In the preceding year, the patient has had fatigue, weight loss, joint pain, and intermittent abdominal pain. Laboratory studies show increased blood urea nitrogen and serum creatinine. Right-upper quadrant ultrasound shows no evidence of gallstones, but an inflamed gallbladder is present. The patient undergoes cholecystectomy, and subsequent biopsy of the submucosal gallbladder vessels is shown in the exhibit (2 images) {{exhibit_1}} {{exhibit_2}}. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
question_stem.zh: 一名45岁女性因右腹上象限进行性疼痛3天、恶心和呕吐来就诊。在过去一年中，患者出现疲劳、体重减轻、关节疼痛和间歇性腹痛。实验室检查显示血尿素氮和血清肌酐升高。右上象限超声检查未发现胆结石，但存在胆囊炎症。患者接受胆囊切除术，随后显示的胆囊 submucosal 血管活检结果见图（2张图片） {{exhibit_1}} {{exhibit_2}}。以下哪项是最可能的诊断？

question.en: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
question.zh: 以下哪项是最可能的诊断？

C.zh: 伴多血管炎的肉芽肿病

explanation.en:
Polyarteritis nodosa

Pathophysiology

Correlation with underlying hepatitis B/C (immune complexes)
Fibrinoid necrosis of arterial wall luminal narrowing & thrombosis tissue ischemia
Internal/external elastic lamina damage microaneurysm formation rupture & bleeding
Clinical features

Constitutional: fever, weight loss, malaise
Skin: nodules, livedo reticularis, ulcers, purpura
Renal: hypertension, renal insufficiency, arterial aneurysms
Nervous: headache, seizures, mononeuritis multiplex
Gastrointestinal: mesenteric ischemia/infarction
Musculoskeletal: myalgias, arthritis
Diagnosis

Negative ANCA & ANA
Angiography: microaneurysms & segmental/distal narrowing
Tissue biopsy: nongranulomatous transmural inflammation
ANA = antinuclear antibodies; ANCA = antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibodies.

This patient's vomiting, right upper quadrant pain, and gallbladder inflammation with no evidence of gallstones indicates acute acalculous cholecystitis. Although a variety of conditions cause acute acalculous cholecystitis, the presence of long-standing, nonspecific symptoms (eg, fatigue, weight loss, arthralgias) and biopsy findings of fibrinoid necrosis of the submucosal arteries of the gallbladder raise strong suspicion for polyarteritis nodosa (PAN).

PAN is a systemic vasculitis of medium-sized muscular arteries; biopsy of affected areas generally reveals the following:

Segmental fibrinoid necrosis (amorphic, eosinophilic areas) of the vessel wall
Infiltration of the vessel wall with mononuclear cells and neutrophils
Internal and external elastic laminae damage, which may cause microaneurysms
In contrast to many other vasculitides (eg, granulomatosis with polyangiitis), there is no granulomatous inflammation in PAN.

PAN typically attacks arteries of the kidneys (eg, increased BUN/creatinine), skin, neurologic system, and gastrointestinal tract; most cases present due to symptoms of tissue ischemia from artery lumen narrowing/thrombosis or bleeding from microaneurysm rupture. In this case, damage to the submucosal gallbladder arteries likely caused gallbladder ischemia, which lead to acalculous cholecystitis. Other common gastrointestinal findings in PAN include bead-like microaneurysm formation in the mesenteric vessels, mesenteric ischemia, and bowel necrosis/rupture.

(Choice A) Angiodysplasia is thought to arise from intermittent obstruction of submucosal veins at the muscularis propria of the gastrointestinal tract. Biopsy shows dilated small vessels lined by thin-walled endothelium; infiltration with inflammatory cells would not be seen. In addition, patients with angiodysplasia generally have gastrointestinal bleeding, not acalculous cholecystitis.

(Choice B) Antiphospholipid-antibody syndrome is characterized by small-vessel thrombosis due to the formation of autoantibodies against phospholipid-binding proteins. It is often triggered by underlying systemic lupus erythematosus, which can cause long-standing nonspecific symptoms. However, acute biopsy would show thrombosed vessels, not vessels with fibrinoid necrosis and neutrophilic inflammation.

(Choice C) Granulomatosis with polyangiitis is an antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibody-positive vasculitis that generally affects the upper airways, lungs, and kidneys. Gastrointestinal involvement is uncommon.

(Choice E) Thromboangiitis obliterans primarily attacks vessels in the extremities. It is marked by inflammatory thrombi with relative sparing of the vessel wall and intact internal elastic lamina. Fibrinoid necrosis would not be seen. Most cases are seen in young smokers.

Educational objective:

Polyarteritis nodosa is characterized by segmental, transmural, necrotizing inflammation of medium-sized muscular arteries. Manifestations arise due to tissue ischemia from arterial lumen narrowing/thrombosis or bleeding from microaneurysms. The vessels of the kidneys, skin, peripheral nerves, and gastrointestinal tract are affected most commonly; the lung is typically spared. {{exhibit_3}} {{exhibit_4}}
explanation.zh:
结节性多动脉炎

病理生理学

与潜在的乙型/丙型肝炎相关（免疫复合物）
动脉壁纤维素样坏死，管腔狭窄和血栓形成，组织缺血
内/外弹力板损伤，微动脉瘤形成，破裂和出血
临床表现

全身症状：发热，体重减轻，乏力
皮肤：结节，网状青斑，溃疡，紫癜
肾脏：高血压，肾功能不全，动脉瘤
神经系统：头痛，癫痫发作，多发性单神经炎
胃肠道：肠系膜缺血/梗死
肌肉骨骼：肌痛，关节炎
诊断

ANCA和ANA阴性
血管造影：微动脉瘤和节段性/远端狭窄
组织活检：非肉芽肿性全层炎症
ANA = 抗核抗体；ANCA = 抗中性粒细胞胞质抗体。

该患者的呕吐、右上象限疼痛以及胆囊炎症，且无胆结石的证据，提示急性非结石性胆囊炎。虽然多种疾病可引起急性非结石性胆囊炎，但存在长期、非特异性症状（如疲劳、体重减轻、关节痛）和胆囊 submucosal 动脉纤维素样坏死的活检结果强烈提示结节性多动脉炎 (PAN)。

PAN 是一种累及中等大小肌性动脉的全身性血管炎；受累部位的活检通常显示如下：

血管壁节段性纤维素样坏死（无定形、嗜酸性区域）
血管壁浸润单核细胞和中性粒细胞
内、外弹力板损伤，可引起微动脉瘤
与许多其他血管炎（如伴多血管炎的肉芽肿病）不同，PAN 中没有肉芽肿性炎症。

PAN 典型地侵袭肾脏（如血尿素氮/肌酐升高）、皮肤、神经系统和胃肠道的动脉；大多数病例表现为动脉管腔狭窄/血栓形成引起的组织缺血或微动脉瘤破裂出血的症状。在这种情况下，胆囊 submucosal 动脉的损伤可能导致胆囊缺血，进而导致非结石性胆囊炎。PAN 中其他常见的胃肠道表现包括肠系膜血管中串珠状微动脉瘤形成、肠系膜缺血以及肠坏死/破裂。

(选项 A) 血管发育不良被认为源于胃肠道肌层间 submucosal 静脉的间歇性阻塞。活检显示扩张的小血管，内衬薄壁内皮；不会出现炎症细胞浸润。此外，血管发育不良患者通常会出现胃肠道出血，而非非结石性胆囊炎。

(选项 B) 抗磷脂抗体综合征的特征是由于形成针对磷脂结合蛋白的自身抗体而导致的小血管血栓形成。它通常由潜在的系统性红斑狼疮触发，可引起长期的非特异性症状。然而，急性活检会显示血栓形成血管，而不是具有纤维素样坏死和中性粒细胞炎症的血管。

(选项 C) 伴多血管炎的肉芽肿病是一种抗中性粒细胞胞质抗体阳性的血管炎，通常影响上呼吸道、肺和肾脏。胃肠道受累并不常见。

(选项 E) 血栓闭塞性脉管炎主要侵袭四肢血管。其特征是炎症性血栓形成，相对保留血管壁和完整的内弹力板。不会出现纤维素样坏死。大多数病例见于年轻吸烟者。

教育目标：

结节性多动脉炎的特征是中等大小肌性动脉的节段性、全层、坏死性炎症。表现为动脉管腔狭窄/血栓形成引起的组织缺血或微动脉瘤出血。肾脏、皮肤、周围神经和胃肠道的血管最常受累；肺通常不受影响。{{exhibit_3}} {{exhibit_4}}

summary.en:
This question tests knowledge of polyarteritis nodosa (PAN), a systemic vasculitis of medium-sized muscular arteries, and its clinical presentation including acalculous cholecystitis and nonspecific systemic symptoms. It also tests the ability to interpret biopsy findings of fibrinoid necrosis in the submucosal arteries.

To solve this question, recognize the combination of acalculous cholecystitis, systemic symptoms (fatigue, weight loss, arthralgias), and biopsy findings of fibrinoid necrosis as suggestive of PAN. Rule out other vasculitides based on their typical organ involvement and biopsy characteristics.
summary.zh:
此题考察对结节性多动脉炎 (PAN) 的知识，PAN 是一种累及中等大小肌性动脉的全身性血管炎，其临床表现包括非结石性胆囊炎和非特异性全身症状。同时也考察了解读 submucosal 动脉纤维素样坏死活检结果的能力。

为了解决这个问题，需要认识到非结石性胆囊炎、全身症状（疲劳、体重减轻、关节痛）和纤维素样坏死的活检结果组合提示 PAN。根据其他血管炎的典型器官受累和活检特征排除其他血管炎。
